metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11696 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the __hash_open function in lib/dbm/src/hash.c in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) allows context-dependent attackers to have unspecified impact using a crafted cert8.db file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Upstream NSS will not be fixing this issue. this is an issue in libnssdbm. NSS 3.35 made SQLite the default datastore. NSS 3.49 stopped building the legacy datastore.

criterions.comment: nss package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1').
